settings.title: Why learning here feels different
settings.subtitle: Our courses are designed by professional developers to help you master React.js and modern web development practices.
settings.content: At School of Tomorrow's AI you don't just follow tutorials — you rehearse futures. We treat AI as a co-pilot for radical imagination. Each course blends body, space, sensors and code so you can prototype with your hands, your tools and your curiosity.

list.name: Lina Lopes

settings.title: Common Questions About Our School Courses
settings.subtitle: Get answers to frequently asked questions about our React.js training program

questions.title: Do I need programming experience to join?
questions.content: No. Most courses are designed for curious beginners. We explain the basics step-by-step and offer optional "deeper dives" for participants who already have experience with code or creative technology.

questions.title: What tools do I need to get started?
questions.content: At minimum, you'll need a laptop, a modern web browser and a stable internet connection. For some courses we share a short materials list in advance — usually simple things like paper, tape, cardboard, sensors or small electronics. Any extra tools required will always be listed on each course page.

questions.title: How long does each course take?
questions.content: Our courses are usually 2–4 hours long, with optional self-paced activities you can do before or after. When we run multi-session programs, they are broken into short, focused sessions so you can fit them into your week more easily.

questions.title: Will I get access to future updates of the courses?
questions.content: Yes. When you enroll in a course, you get access to updated versions of the videos, notes and resources for at least 12 months. If we significantly rework or expand a course, we'll let you know by email so you can explore what's new.
